main event: A civilian observed a bright-white spherical object moving overhead in Scarsdale, New York on January 6, 1967.
interesting points: The object had a front portion and a tail section with three or four lights and a pulsating light at the front., The object moved in a parabolic arc before disappearing straight up., The sighting lasted approximately three minutes., The observer was a 13-year-old student who reported the sighting to their mother., Local radar was unable to detect the object according to the investigating officer.
witness description: 13 years old, civilian, student, reliable sighting
